data.title: Current Living Former Prime Ministers, Premiers And Chief Ministers
data.meta_description: The tables on this page show the full lists of living former heads of government in Australia.
data.text:
The tables on this page show the full lists of living former heads of government in Australia.

There are 70 former prime ministers, premiers and chief ministers still living, as of June 10, 2024.

All seven former prime ministers since Paul Keating assumed the office in 1991 are still living.

Nine former Premiers of NSW since Barrie Unsworth took office in 1988 are still living, as are all seven former premiers of Western Australia since Brian Burke took office in 1983.

The death of former Chief Minister of the Northern Territory, Ian Tuxworth, on January 21, 2020, was the first death a chief minister since 1970, the longest period of government in any state or territory where all former leaders were still alive.

Following the death of Steele Hall on June 10, 2024, the oldest former leader is Barrie Unsworth, 90. Unsworth was NSW Premier, 1986-88.

The youngest members on the lists are former Northern Territory chief ministers Adam Giles, 51, and Michael Gunner, 48, and former Tasmanian premier Lara Giddings, 51.

Steele Hall’s death means no former head of government from the 1960s is still living. From the 1970s, there are two surviving heads of government: Doug Lowe, Tasmanian Premier (1977-81), and Paul Everingham, Northern Territory

Majority Leader and Chief Minister (1977-84).

The most recent deaths have been:

Jun 10, 2024: Steele Hall – 95 – South Australian Premier (Liberal) 1968-70

Aug 11, 2023: Mike Ahern – 81 – Queensland Premier (Country Party) 1987-89

Mar 10, 2023: Goff Letts – 95 – Northern Territory Chief Minister (Country Liberal Party) 1974-77

Sep 12, 2020: John Fahey – 75 – NSW Premier (Liberal) 1992-95

Jan 21, 2020: Ian Tuxworth – 77 – Northern Territory Chief Minister (CLP) 1984-86

Dec 23, 2019: John Cain – 88 – Victorian Premier (ALP) 1990-92

May 16, 2019: Bob Hawke – 89 – Prime Minister (ALP) 1983-91

Apr 25, 2016: Tom Lewis – 94 – NSW Premier (Liberal) 1975-76

Dec 13, 2015: John Bannon – 72 – S.A. Premier (ALP) 1982-92

Jun 01, 2015: Joan Kirner – 76 – Victorian Premier (ALP) 1990-92

Mar 20, 2015: Malcolm Fraser – 84 – Prime Minister (Liberal) 1975-83

Nov 10, 2014: Wayne Goss – 63 – Queensland Premier (ALP) 1989-96

Oct 21, 2014: Gough Whitlam – 98 – Prime Minister (ALP) 1972-75

Apr 20, 2014: Neville Wran – 87 – NSW Premier (ALP) 1976-86

Note: The ages on these lists are generated automatically and are always up-to-date.
